snippet: Retired players and their beneficiaries can now vote on the deal, which includes a promise from the N.F.L. to pay an unlimited amount of awards to players with certain neurological conditions.
abstract: Federal Judge Anita B Brody approves preliminary settlement between NFL and lawyers for over 4,500 retired players who sued league for concealing risks of concussions; had rejected earlier $765 million deal over concerns that money would not cover 65-year life of settlement; new agreement, to be voted on by 20,000 retired players, removes cap on damages but allows NFL to contest unlimited number of requests for awards.
lead_paragraph: Retired players and their beneficiaries can now vote on the deal, which includes a promise from the N.F.L. to pay an unlimited amount of awards to players with certain neurological conditions.

headline.main: Altered N.F.L. Settlement Wins Judge’s Approval
headline.print_headline: Altered N.F.L. Settlement Wins Judge’s Approval
